ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Abashi finally responds... sort of
ygData.msgSnippet: Kaearia s comments are on the Abashi thread at the Concert Hall board.  URL to the thread:
ygData.messageBody:
Kaearia's comments are on the Abashi thread at the Concert Hall board. URL
to the thread:
http://pub5.ezboard.com/ftheconcerthallbackstage.showMessageRange?topicID=57
59.topic&start=21&stop=37

Kaearia has a couple of comments in the thread. Part of the one I referred
to is pasted below:

(snip)
I've never felt any of the folks working on EQ were particularly strong in
the math department. I won't attribute to malice what can be explained by
stupidity. This game is going to be killed because of that stupidity once
some reasonable competition appears. I don't see much point in trying to
argue with a rock about esoteric game balance issues, and am just glad to
see some resolution of the less esoteric ones.
(snip)

Galtin of E'ci

-----Original Message-----
From: John Tatsukawa [mailto:john@...]
Sent: Wednesday, October 11, 2000 11:36 AM
To: eqbards@egroups.com
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Abashi finally responds... sort of


Ugh. Well obviously if you can't convince them with cold, hard statistics
then I guess that would encourage ranting.

If you have a copy of his post (or a url to it) I'd appreciate reading what
he said. Sounds like bad news to me though.

Windleaf

At 09:31 PM 10/11/00 +0000, you wrote:
>I think you misinterpreted Kaearia (John Kim's) position. He stated he
>did not think Verant was maliciously screwing over bards. Instead, he
>thinks that they are a bunch of idiots who have no idea what they are
>doing in regards to bards. So he is no longer going to worry about trying
>to use logic, statistical analysis, etc. to fight for improvements to the
>bard class since they don't have a clue what they are doing. Thats the
>way I interpreted his post.
>
>Galtin of E'ci
>

>From: Jeffrey Sue [mailto:jsue@...]
